docs.lead_paragraph: O'LEARY--Denis J.,M.D., 86 in Rye, NY, formerly of Rancho Bernardo, CA and Scarsdale, NY. Beloved husband of Audrey (Ryan), father of Michael, Brian, Denis and Kevin and grandfather to ten. Born Cork, Ireland and medical graduate of University College, Cork. He was an influential and recognized authority in occupational and preventive medicine. Captain in the US Army, Korean War. Retired 1987, Senior Vice President, New York Life Insurance Co. in charge of employees health. Senior attending physician, Chest Service, Bellevue Hospital. Assistant clinical professor at NYU. Past president: American Lung Association; Alcoholism Council of New York; Occupational Medical Association New York. Fellow American College Chest Physicians, American Public Health Association, and Occupational Medical Association. An eternally optimistic golfer and enthusiastic Irish bass, his voice, love and intellect will be sorely missed. A private family service will be held.

docs.lead_paragraph: Is it possible that one motivation for insurance fraud is to get back at insurance companies that provide poor service?

headline.main: Getting Revenge Against Your Insurance Company

docs.abstract: A new Accenture survey suggests that insurance fraud may be how some consumers retaliate against poor service from insurance companies.
